column4: upon running   gnome-session --display :0   X crashed with this message.    Fatal server error:
thats where the error message came from
no.  there is nothing wrong with X.
the Xserver was running fine.  starting gnome-session is what brought it down.
was this after a dapper upgrade?
fluxbox is now connected to the xserver  working fine.    any thought on what might be wrong with gnome ?
it seems some folks are having issues upon upgrade bug #20371
yeah.  i've been there.  i couldn't find anything i liked about dapper, so i wiped it and installed hoary.
so this is a fresh install of hoary? and did you keep your /home data?
if you have kept your gnome config files (.gnome* .gconf*), you might want to move them aside and see if the problem persists

no it's not a /home problem  either...   jighead don't worry about it this is the first "default" install i've ever tried to use.   i'll remove gnome and install twm and be just 'pickeled tink' about it....
thanks for the fish just the same.
that is, if you are looking for something between kde/gnome and twm/fluxbox
i've used xfce4 fvwm icewm blackbox and more, thanks tho
